summary: adenoviruses are human pathogens, causing infections and diseases of the respiratory, ocular, gastrointestinal, genitourinary, and metabolic systems. adenovirus isolates with highly similar genomes are associated with sporadic and limited infections as well as with larger, wide-spread outbreaks. in children and immunocompromised individuals, HAdV infections may lead to significant rates of mortality. 84 genotypes, including all previously characterized serotypes, have been sequenced, characterized, and classified within seven species A–G. species B HAdVs have been divided into subspecies B1 and B2 based on their genome similarities and restriction enzyme digestion patterns. the same genome type, HAdV-B14p1, appeared in europe with two ARD outbreaks in Ireland (2009) and the U.K. (2011).5, 11, 50 These resulted in the highest fatality rates reported for HAdV-B14 outbreaks, at 33% and 23% respectively. data will provide a basis for public health preventive measures. specific information of mutation rates, mutation hotspots, and new variations, particularly at serologic recognition sites, will play a key role in the development of vaccines against these pathogens. genome sequence of HAdV-B14p1 strain GZ01 was obtained using the Sanger sequencing method following PCR amplification of targeted overlapping 1–2 kb regions that covered the entire genome. the genome was annotated with an annotation protocol used for the HAdV-C1 genome analysis,35 by first dividing the sequence into contiguous 1 kb non-overlapping segments. phylogenetic analysis of select genes and whole genomes was performed using MEGA 5.1.0 (http://www.megasoftware.net/megamac.php) gene type identification In silico restriction maps of available genome sequences from all HAdV-14 strains CHN/GZ01/2010, 303600, CHN/BJ430, CHN2012, and prototype de Wit were generated using the Vector NTI 10.3.0 software. single gene entries in GenBank were extracted from the genome files. the genome, fiber, hexon, and E1A sequences of adenovirus species A–G were used in this study. cells, virus stock, and DNA preparation HAdV-B14p1 GZ01 was isolated from a throat swab of a 17-month-old child hospitalized with acute suppurative tonsillitis. all the experimental protocols in this study were approved by the institutional ethics committee of Southern Medical University. the informed consent for participation in this study was obtained from the guardian of the under-aged participant. data records of the sample and sample collection are de-identified and completely anonymous. phylogenetic analysis of select genes and whole genomes was performed using MEGA 5.1.0 (http://www.megasoftware.net/megamac.php), which accepts FASTA files for sequence alignment. silico restriction maps of available genome sequences from all HAdV-14 strains were generated. if no further designation is noted, the strain is the prototype. the genome, fiber, hexon, and hexon genes were either deposited as single gene entries in GenBank or extracted from the genome files. fibre Hexon HQ163916 HQ265808 HAdV-B14p1 303600 2007 USA Genome FJ822614 HAdV-B14p1 BJ430 2010 China Genome JN032132 HAdV-B14p1 GZ01 2010 China Genome JQ824845 HAdV-B14p1 CHN2012 2012 China Genome JX892927 HAdV-B14 Gansu2011-01 2011 China He a total of 38 coding sequences were identified. the genome comprises 34 767 bp, with a GC content of 48.83%. this is consistent with the other members of subspecies B2. REA profiles of strains GZ01, BJ430, and CHN2012 were consistent with and indistinguishable from that of HAdV-14p1 strain 303600, all which were confirmed to be genome type 14p1 according to the nomenclature published previously. however, genome type analysis by REA patterns may be misleading or incomplete. all three recent China outbreak genomes correspond to the genome type of HAdV-14p1 and have identical REA profiles to each other. the HAdV-B14p1 GZ01 genome has a 137 bp ITR that is identical to the ITRs of the other HAdV-B14p1 strains (BJ430, CHN2012, and 303600) all four HAdV-B14p1 genomes differ from HAdV-B14p at position 68, with a C present, a transition mutation from the original T. this particular T is also found at the complementary 3'-end, a validation that it is not a sequencing error. phylogenetic analysis of select genes and the whole genomes Of the five recent China strains, only three were reported with whole genome data. nucleotide sequences of the E1A, fiber, and hexon genes, as well as the whole genome sequences, are available from GenBank. taxon names include GenBank acc. no., isolation country, strain name, and year of isolation. both strains GZ01 and BJ430 are highly divergent from 303600. there is one indel distinguishing between GZ01 and BJ430. a deletion at nt 29 481 in the BJ430 genome could be interpreted as GZ01 more similar to 303600. the circulating and independently isolated HAdV-B14p1 strains have divergent, yet similar mutation profiles. the genome of HAdV-14p1_303600/USA/2007 is set as the reference to which the other genomes are compared. two deletions, three T (nt 10 658) and one A (nt 13 266), in poly (T) and poly (A) regions, are also noted. a deletion of A at nt 29 481 in the BJ430 genome distinguishes it from GZ01. — — — in non-coding regions, which led to length changes of the corresponding poly(A) or poly(T) sequences. compared with strain 303600, 11 base substitutions were found in strain CHN2012, which resulted in two non-synonymous substitutions in the E1B 54.9 K, E3 20.8 K coding regions. a total of 38 coding sequences were identified. the genome types of strains GZ01, BJ430, and CHN2012 were determined by in silico REA using the Vector NTI 10.3.0 software. the REA profiles of GZ01, BJ430, and CHN2012 were consistent with and indistinguishable from that of HAdV-14p1 strain 303600. in silico restriction enzyme analysis digestion patterns of HAdV-14 genomes were generated using the Vector NTI 10.3.0 software. all three recent China outbreak genomes correspond to the genome type of HAdV-14p1 and have identical REA profiles. the first 64 bases are completely identical amongst the prototype subspecies B2 ITRs, which is different for divergent subspecies B1 members. the binding sites for the host transcription factors NF I and NF III were identified in the ITR. the nucleotide varies for the other six HAdV species. phylogenetic analysis of select genes and the whole genomes Of the five recent China strains, only three were reported with whole genome data. the phylogenetic analysis of the HAdV-B14 E1A, fiber, and hexon genes also confirms the sequence similarity with the prototype genome after approximately 50 years. the Chinese HAdV-B14 strains were indicated with filled triangles. the scale bar is in units of nucleotide substitutions per site. a global visualization of the alignment of genome sequences of HAdV-B14p1 viruses is presented in Figure 5. 303600, BJ430, GZ01, and 303600 have highly similar percent identities in comparison with the prototype de Wit at 99.646%, 99.666%, 99.684%, and 99.689%, respectively. genome of HAdV-14p1_303600/USA/2007 is set as reference to which other genomes are compared. base substitution analysis of type 14 strains GZ01, BJ430, CHN2012, GZ01. all of the indels occurred in non-coding regions, which led to length changes of the corresponding poly(A) or poly(T) sequences. 93 base substitutions in the 31 genes, resulting in 35 non-synonymous substitutions. emergence, re-emergence, and transmission of a particular pathogen may be followed using high-resolution genome sequencing. all three HAdV-B14 strains appear to be of separate, but related lineages and may have been transmitted from abroad. uniquely, Guangzhou has four additional direct long-standing connections to the international community. the 2005 re-emergent HAdV-B14p1 strain was associated with several highly contagious and geographically wide-spread outbreaks of ARD. the 2005 re-emergent HAdV-B14p1 strain was associated with several highly contagious and geographically wide-spread outbreaks. indel mutations analysis suggests two co-circulating lines from at least two co-circulating ‘prototype’ strains in 1950s, one giving rise to the 303600 strain and the other giving rise to the China cluster of HAdV-B14. REA is still useful for characterizing current isolates by providing a bridge between their accessible genome data and the REA data that are only available in the literature. the genome sequences of strains GZ01 and BJ430 are nearly identical with each other, with respect to point mutation patterns. a major difference between the two genomes is the two non-synonymous substitutions in the DNA polymerase (K to N) and protein VI genes (R to K), respectively. the non-synonymous substitution of R to K in the protein VI may lead to the function of protein VI being enhanced or weakened, which can presumably further change the HAdV tissue tropism. there had been no reports of HAdV-B14 in china prior to and during the period noted for HAdV-B14 re-emergence and circulation (2005–2009)
